metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6789 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the MutationObserver implementation in Blink, as used inGoogle Chrome before 47.0.2526.80, allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (use-after-free) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact by leveraging unanticipated object deletion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6789` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.106-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1107
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.106-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1107
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.106-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1107
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.106-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1107
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.106-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1107
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.11.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.11.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.11.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.11.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.11.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.11.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.11.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.106-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1107').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.11.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
